revised_title: Foraging Strategies and Natural Diet of Early Human Societies
tldr: This article discusses the wide range of plant and animal foods consumed by early human societies, highlighting their nutritional compositions and the factors influencing food choice. It also explores the development of food processing technologies and how they affected the human diet. The article emphasizes the importance of variety and adaptability in early human diets, which allowed them to survive in diverse environments and food scarcity situations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Evolution and Anthropology
